page.title: 19DIALECT TRANSLATED
page.content: Most little towns in S.E. England are having good times.Buckfastleigh is the same;it is a really busy little place. Normally the traffic is so thick people can hardly get from one side to the other.It is fortunate a dual carriageway goes around the town and a big quarry lies nearby so the stone for the road is easy to process.Most of the old trades have gone and have been replaced by little workshops, though they still dress the skins, adorn them and export them.The folks here are most friendly and always thoughtful towards their neighbours. Buckfastleigh is world famous for the caves and tourists come from everywhere to enjoy the hills around Dartmoor and the beautiful meadows of the South Hams as far as the sea.
